Outreach Programme - Widening the engagement. To provide quality content engaging the Myanmar public on critical issues relevant to Myanmar and the country’s future, and to model the values espoused by U Thant.

target.value: - Maintain LostFootsteps.org with an average of 2 longer and well researched articles per month introducing Myanmar audiences to new issues. Audience engagement. number of users and page views. - Launch a social media strategy for U Thant House facebook page and website

actual.value: Four completely new articles were produced and published on LostFootsteps web. The number of average users per month is 12,370 , And the total number of views for the last quarter is 98,222 . The website now serves around 700,000 unique users. U Thant House’s official Facebook page increased followers from 73,402 to 82,000. Produced 22 posts. Three substantive posts per month.

target.value: Maintain LostFootsteps.org with an average of 2 longer and well researched articles per month introducing Myanmar audiences to new issues. Audience engagement. number of users and page views. - U Thant House Facebook page: Number of posts. Presence measured in number of followers. Engagement measured in likes and shares. and comments on posts. Reach and influence measured in post reach and views. in general and among target audience. Qualitative analysis of sentiments and impact on target audience

actual.value: In the month of January articles on www.LostFootsteps.org had 21,112 views by 10,922 unique users. The number of users dropped significantly since February 2021. In February the number of views and users dropped to half of its normal levels. From January to July 2021, there were only 38,563 users with 83,011 views, averaging around 5,500 users a month. Analysis and commentary on Myanmar since the coup was published in leading newspapers and magazines around the world, including Foreign Affairs, Foreign Policy, the Guardian, the New York Times, and the Financial Times. However, the number of users or viewers dropped significantly in the period following the February 1, 2021 military coup. Internet use has been fraught by the political situation and social media channels are being closely monitored by the authorities, and even inaccessible at times. In view of the political situation and to protect the safety of staff, other communications channels 'Twitter and Global Media' were used.

title.narrative: Topics identified and highlighted by U Thant House have been introduced to the Myanmar public and are increasingly being discussed.

Research & Dialogue Programme – Transforming Public Debate. To transform public debate around key issues facing the country and to help identify creative solutions through the hosting of seminars and discussions in the neutral space of U Thant House. To identify pressing issues currently neglected in Myanmar public debate with the aim of bringing attention to those issues and help set the agenda for discussion among influencers, policy and decisionmakers and generate new ideas and approaches in tackling those issues. and provide a window onto global debates to enable new thinking about local challenges and new ways to reimagine the future.

target.value: - Covid-19 situation permitting. the goal is to convene 8 seminars (virtual. if not in person). 3 Roundtable discussions. and one annual lecture. - Engagement with top decision makers at ministry permanent secretary level or above. - Setting the agenda: evidence of having introduced terms and topics in the public debate. including media and civil society

actual.value: In January 2020, U Thant House hosted the Annual U Thant Memorial Lecture, with over 200 people in attendance. The new topics, (1) Political Economy: ‘Reimagining Development in Myanmar’, and; (2) Climate Change: ‘Myanmar’s Climate Crisis’, identified and highlighted by U Thant House have been introduced to the Myanmar public and are increasingly being discussed. U Thant House held a series of meetings such as Core Partners Group Roundtable, the Business Group Roundtable, Partners Working Group discussions, External Stakeholders meetings.

target.value: - Convene 8 seminars. 3 Roundtable discussions. and one annual lecture. - Engagement with top decision makers at ministry permanent secretary level or above. - Setting the agenda: evidence of having introduced terms and topics in the public debate. including media and civil society

actual.value: UTH has managed to continue its planned work on the political economy of Myanmar: both through regular monitoring and analysis of the developing situation, as well as research of how Myanmar’s political economy has evolved over the previous decades. UTH has led a series of discussions on the post-military coup future of Myanmar. UTH have had approximately 80 discussions between February 2 and July 2021, including with leading Myanmar political figures, business people, and analysts.

title.narrative: Well maintained museum and exhibition open to the public, staffed with skilled guides/learning facilitators engaging the visitors. Educational materials and activities that help model values such as peace and tolerance and safeguarding the environment tai

Museum & Education Programme – Inspiring Future Generations: To broaden the horizons of youth and young adults in Myanmar by encouraging new thinking and introducing critical issues not sufficiently covered in the national curriculum (peace and tolerance and the need to safeguard our natural environment), and to model the values U Thant espoused and encourage reflection on how they apply to students’ daily lives in terms of upholding human dignity, challenging prejudice, and promoting nonviolence, and caring for the earth

target.value: 6000 visitors. of which at least 3000 will be students. 60 school groups (recover the same level as in 2019. In 2021 we will have developed age-specific education materials for elementary and secondary school students. and we will have piloted the materials with a focus group of teachers. School tour script and interactive elements.

actual.value: Age-specific education materials targeted at elementary and secondary school students were developed and piloted with a focus group of teachers. The materials were developed in the form of ten lesson plans and a package with instructions for educators, and a School tour script(s) and interactive activities tailored to two different age-groups: elementary and secondary school students, were developed. Training in delivery of both the lesson plans as well as the tour(s) have been conducted with the dedicated U Thant House guides and facilitators of school groups. As a result, U Thant House now have not only a packet of lesson plans and activities, but also tour scripts as well as a blue print for how to train staff in delivery of the education packet and activities. Work to develop age specific materials targeted at students 16-20 years of age commenced in late 2021 as in underway.

target.value: Currently the programme is unable to set ambitious targets for visitor numbers in 2020 as the museum. due to the Covid19 pandemic. It is hoped that it could be open as normal from September 2020. public health situation permitting. 200-400 visitors per month is expected. once the museum is opened again.

actual.value: The project focused on developing educational materials for the younger target groups, namely grade 3 to grade 8 students (8-15 years of age). Produced a prototype package of age-appropriate quality education materials that can both serve as a supplement to the national curricula teaching of U Thant in primary and middle school. Produced two versions of a script that promises an engaging and interactive tour at the U Thant House. The main proportion (523) of direct beneficiaries of the project are students under 18 years of age that constitutes the number of students and the teachers who were engaged in the focus group throughout the project.

target.value: At least 5 new ideas developed and introduced by U Thant House. having an influence on the public debate in Myanmar as evidenced by for examples: being debated at events external to U Thant House. and reflected in media articles and opinion pieces with an extensive reach. and shared on social media.

actual.value: U Thant House Trust influenced debates by introducing and advocating ideas in Political Economy, Poverty and Vulnerability, Multilateralism, and Climate Change
